title: 27 RSS Activists Charged For Laying Floral Carpet In Kerala Temple
content: A case was registered against 27 RSS activists for laying a floral carpet at a temple in this district as part of Onam festivities, police said on Saturday.

title: 'Blood Moon' Rises, Rare Total Lunar Eclipse Lights Up The Sky
content: Stargazers were in for a treat as they turned their gaze towards the Moon Sunday night to witness a rare 'Blood Moon' or the total lunar eclipse, the longest since 2022, visible acrossAsia and swathes of Europe and Africa.

title: Man Strangles Daughter In Maharashtra, Hangs Body To Pass It Off As Suicide
content: A man allegedly killed his daughter and then tried to pass it off as suicide in Maharashtra's Jalna district, a police official said on Sunday.

title: Shashi Tharoor Urges Caution On Trump's "New Tone" On India-US Ties
content: Reacting to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's response to US President Donald Trump on the India-US relationship, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Sunday stated that while PM Modi was very quick to respond

title: Experts, Ex Officers Allege Factual Errors In PUCL Report On Manipur, Raise 16 Points
content: Fourteen individuals including Manipur's noted filmmaker Aribam Syam Sharma and 24 civil society organisations have alleged several factual errors and incongruences in a recent report by a Delhi-based non-profit on the Manipur ethnic violence.

title: Karnataka Man Arrested For Acid Attack On Daughter, Niece
content: Police on Sunday arrested a 48-year-old man for allegedly pouring acid on his daughter and niece at Parakadavu in this northern district here.

title: Badrinath, Kedarnath Temples Shut Ahead Of Lunar Eclipse
content: Ahead of the nationwide lunar eclipse on Sunday night, the gates of Badrinath and Kedarnath temples, along with all subordinate shrines under the Badrinath-Kedarnath Temple Committee (BKTC), have been closed, as part of age-old religious traditions.

title: PM Modi Attends Workshop For BJP MPs, Resolution On GST Reforms Passed
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, along with MPs of the NDA attended the 'Sansad Karyashala' on Sunday, a two-day workshop organised by the Bharatiya Janata Party for the MPs to share their views on a diverse range of issues

title: Woman Dead, 18 Injured In Fire In 24-Storey Building In Mumbai's Dahisar
content: A woman died and 18 people were injured in a fire that broke out in a 24-storey building in Dahisar in north Mumbai on Sunday, officials said.

title: "4 Acres? I Have 40": M Kharge Chides Farmer For Crop Damage Complaint
content: A farmer who came to Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge to complain about his crop, got an earful recently. The man had visited Mr Kharge's home in Kalaburagi -- a region still reeling under rain which has taken a massive toll on the crops.

title: South Korea To Bring Home 300 Workers Detained In Hyundai Plant Raid In US
content: More than 300 South Korean workers detained following a massive immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in Georgia will be released and brought home, the South Korean government announced Sunday.

title: Tiffin Meet, Singapore's Cleanliness In PM Modi's Mantra To MPs At BJP Workshop
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave a series of dos and don'ts to MPs of then BJP today, asking them to think, innovate and ensure the government schemes are running smoothly.

title: 4 Students' Chopper Ride To Uttarakhand Exam Centre After Landslide Blocks Road
content: Four students from Rajasthan reached Haldwani in Uttarakhand, but found themselves stuck as continuous rain and landslides had disrupted road movement. They had an exam to write. The students came up with an innovative idea to reach exam centre.

title: Sonu Sood To NDTV: "Roads, Fields Destroyed, People Clueless About Future"
content: Eight-year-old Abhijot Singh suffers from a kidney disorder called Nephrotic Syndrome and needs to visit the PGIMER hospital in Chandigarh approximately every two months for treatment.

title: Tirumala Shrine, Other Telangana Temples Shut Ahead Of Lunar Eclipse
content: In light of the lunar eclipse, which will be seen across the country, officials have temporarily closed all prominent temples in Telangana.

title: Five Madrasa Students Arrested For Murder Of 12-Year-Old Boy In Odisha
content: Five minor students of a madrasa in Odisha's Nayagarh district were arrested for allegedly killing a 12-year-old boy of the institution and dumping his body into a septic tank, an officer said today.

title: Opposition MPs To Practise With 'Mock Poll' For Veep Election
content: Opposition MPs would be briefed on Monday on the procedure to vote in the September 9 vice presidential polls, sources in the INDIA bloc said on Sunday.

title: Lalbaugcha Raja Idol Immersion Expected At Around 11 pm
content: The iconic Lalbaugcha Raja idol was shifted onto a raft after delays since morning due to high tide and technical challenges, with final immersion, delayed by several hours, expected to take place around 11 pm.

title: Hyundai India Slashes Car Prices By Up To Rs 2.4 Lakh After GST Cut
content: Hyundai Motor India announced that it will pass on the full benefit of the recent GST reforms to its customers, offering significant price cuts across its passenger vehicle range.

title: Over 50 People Detained For Vandalism At Hazratbal Shrine
content: More than 50 persons have been detained for questioning in connection with the vandalisation of a plaque with the Ashoka emblem in the Hazratbal shrine here as police intensified searches for those involved in the incident, officials said on Sunday.

title: Illini, Noles crack AP top 10; USF enters at No. 18
content: Ohio State, Penn State and LSU lead the AP Top 25 college football poll, while Illinois and FSU cracked the top 10 and USF bullied its way into its first ranking in seven years.

title: Donƒçiƒá's 42 leads Slovenia; Georgia ousts France
content: Lakers star Luka Donƒçiƒá had 42 points and 10 rebounds as Slovenia held off a fourth-quarter surge from Italy to win 84-77 and set up a quarterfinal match against World Cup winner Germany, while Georgia advanced with a dominant 80-70 win over France.

title: Piastri: McLaren call to swap with Norris 'fair'
content: Oscar Piastri has downplayed the controversy over McLaren's team orders at the Italian Grand Prix, saying it was "fair" for him to cede position to teammate Lando Norris in the closing stages of the race.

title: RB McCaffrey active to play in Niners' opener
content: 49ers star Christian McCaffrey will play against the Seahawks despite a calf issue that landed the running back on the injury report.

title: Melo, Howard, Moore, Bird join hoops Hall of Fame
content: Carmelo Anthony, Dwight Howard, Sue Bird, Maya Moore and Sylvia Fowles were inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame.

title: Belichick wins 1st at UNC, confirms Patriots ban
content: Bill Belichick picked up win No. 1 at North Carolina as it beat Charlotte 20-3. He also confirmed that Patriots scouts have been banned from the Tar Heels facility, saying, "It's obvious I'm not welcome at their facility, so they're not welcome at ours."

title: Ducks dominate after Gundy 'pours gas on fire'
content: After Mike Gundy poured "gasoline on the fire" with his jabs at Oregon's budget, the Ducks proceeded to beat Oklahoma State 69-3.

content: Betting tips and all the info you need to help navigate betting Sunday night's big Ravens-Bills matchup.

title: U.S. loss to South Korea another misstep with World Cup prep time running out
content: You can say this for the USMNT: They're singing from the same songbook of positivity, even as they looked far from being on the same page on the field.

title: Everton beat Liverpool at Anfield to maintain WSL derby dominance
content: Everton manager Brian Sorensen has joked of Anfield being his team's "training pitch," and so it proved as they won 4-1 in Sunday's Merseyside derby.

content: From top-75 locks to vets on the bubble, Zach Kram runs down the active NBA players on the path to Springfield.

content: Micah Parsons wanted to be a Dallas Cowboy "for life." The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones helped chart a course for his exit.

content: Oklahoma State's Mike Gundy and Oregon's Dan Lanning traded barbs Monday after Gundy called attention to the Ducks' sizable budget.

title: üèÄ Caitlin Clark to miss rest of Fever season
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark, who has been limited to 13 games because of injuries and hasn't played since July 15, will miss the remainder of the WNBA season.

title: Army Southern Command chief meets CM Revanth Reddy
content: The discussion was centered on issues concerning military-civil fusion, internal security, veteran welfare, disaster response and development initiatives

title: Sri Lankan Tamils not eligible for long-term visas
content: Although last week‚Äôs Home Ministry order removes the tag of an ‚Äòillegal migrant‚Äô from registered Sri Lankan Tamil nationals who entered India before January 9, 2015, it will not immediately help in grant of Indian citizenship

title: Congress MLA may ask Supreme Court to direct ECI to share data on poll fraud in his constituency with Karnataka CID
content: CID probing forged forms filed to delete voter names in Karnataka‚Äôs Aland constituency in 2023; ECI has not responded to requests for technical data; Congress chief says ECI is stonewalling to shield culprits

content: The Akhila Bharatha Veerashaiva Mahasabha on Sunday appealed to the Veerashaiva-Lingayats to enumerate themselves as ‚Äòothers‚Äô instead of Hindu in the religion column during the socio-educational survey commencing on September 22

content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, referring to The Hindu story on alleged voter fraud in Aland ahead of the Assembly polls in 2023 published on Sunday, said they demand ‚Äòaccountability, answers and justice‚Äô from Election Commission of India

title: Bhupinder Hooda slams BJP govt. in Haryana over portal for flood-hit farmers to seek compensation
content: The Congress leader, on a visit to affected areas, demands immediate compensation even as Chief Minister Naib Singh Saini says the portal had been opened and the farmers would get the compensation soon.

title: Amidst tensions, India-Bangladesh Joint River Commission to meet on September 9
content: Bangladesh expected to ask for a special vehicle to manage the waters of 14 cross-border rivers, sources say; also seeks joint flood forecasting mechanism; Ganga treaty comes up for renewal next year

title: New documentary on late Bhupen Hazarika premiered
content: The documentary titled Bhupen da Uncut premieres ahead of birth centenary celebrations, featuring vintage footage and ‚Äúunpublished‚Äù poems

content: Hope the festival will attract investments, create jobs and will help Vijayawada transform into a major business hub, says MP Kesineni Sivanath

title: Dream of temple in Mathura will be fulfilled: BJP
content: The dream of the Ram Temple has been fulfilled, now it is the turn of Mathura-Vrindavan, says BJP on X

title: Tourism Minister refutes YSRCP claims on medical college privatisation
content: Kandula Durgesh explains benefits of PPP model, says it will speed up construction, add MBBS seats, and keep colleges under government control; outlines phased expansion plans across the State

title: NC, PDP condemn¬†‚Äòdetention¬†of locals‚Äô over Hazratbal incident
content: BJP says ‚Äòvandalism unacceptable‚Äô; the issue was being ‚Äòinstitutionally distorted to represent a twisted litmus test for nationalism‚Äô, NC leader and MP Aga Syed Ruhullah said

title: MSMEs ‚Äòkey to self-reliant India‚Äô, it‚Äôs an ‚Äòopportune time‚Äô to engage in defence sector: DRDO chief
content: Dr. Samir V. Kamat was speaking at a conclave organised by the Defence Technology and Test Centre (DTTC), Lucknow, at its Amausi campus to promote collaboration with industry for the Uttar Pradesh Defence Industrial Corridor.

title: NDA, INDIA blocs to train MPs on voting procedure for Vice-President election
content: The BJP begins two-day workshop on Sunday, with PM Modi sitting at the venue for the entire day. The INDIA bloc will hold a mock polling session for its MPs on Monday. Both blocs cancel plan to host MPs for dinner, considering the flood situation in many States

title: India cautions against misuse of export measures at SCO trade Ministers‚Äô meet
content: At the SCO Trade Ministers' Meeting in Vladivostok, Russia on September 6, India said that calibrated and transparent use of these steps is essential to maintain trust in international commerce

title: CPI(M) accuses KPCC digital cell of throwing a lifeline to the BJP by correlating ‚ÄòBeedis and Biharis‚Äô
content: The comment threatens to retard the political momentum gained by the INDIA bloc‚Äôs 16-day Voter Adhikari Yatra, led by Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav, against ‚Äòvoter list fraud‚Äô ahead of the Bihar polls, says Rajesh

title: Conversations over judges‚Äô appointment, 130th Constitutional amendment dominate SRM law symposium
content: ‚ÄòA 31-day arrest amounts to letting a constable nullify the essence of electoral democracy,‚Äô senior advocate Abhishek Manu Singhvi said on the Bill seeking the removal of MPs or MLAs if they were imprisoned for 30 days

title: NHRC notice to Madhya Pradesh officials over death of infants after rat bites at Indore hospital
content: ‚ÄúSuch a lapse not only breaches the trust of citizens in public healthcare but also constitutes a serious violation of the Right to Life and Health under Article 21 of the Constitution,‚Äù says the rights panel

title: Thin vote margins in the past make Opposition wary of SIR in Bihar
content: As per ADR data, in the 2020 Assembly election, the winning margin was under 1% or less than 3,000 votes in 35 seats. It was less than 5,000 votes in 52 seats. RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav had recently said that the results in about 35 seats could be affected in the upcoming election if even just 1% of the voters are removed from the rolls through the SIR.

title: SNDP Yogam accuses UDF of turning its back on Sabarimala development
content: He accuses Satheesan of conducting a ‚Äúlive dress rehearsal‚Äù as the next Chief Minister of the State without showing the statesmanship qualities required for the top post

title: GST irony plays out in Onam market as consumers postpone purchase plans¬†¬†
content: Many consumers postpone purchase plans anticipating a price fall once the GST revision comes into effect from September 22. Key traders in the State say they saw a dip in customer footfall during Onam, a season  when sales normally peak

title: NDA will form the government in Bihar once again, says Nitish
content: The Bihar CM asserted that rapid development is taking place in all areas and special attention has been given to education and health sectors

title: Hydrotherapy pool at rehabilitation centre near¬†Tiruchi helps rescued elephants cool off
content: The pool is meant to provide muscle relaxation for aged captive elephants suffering from pain and weakness in their legs. The elephants are led to the pool by their mahouts in the morning, and spend about an hour in the water, says an official

title: Punjab floods leave farmers stranded between two seasons
content: Farm outfits say 30% of State‚Äôs paddy crop has been ruined, with the floods leaving the land unsuitable for sowing winter wheat as well; demand compensation of ‚Çπ70,000 per acre, loan waivers

title: Row over land acquisition resurfaces as Devanahalli farmers resume their protest
content: The trigger for farmers‚Äô protest is the KIADB‚Äôs attempt to resume acquisition process by issuing notices in two villages asking them to attend a meeting to fix compensation for their lands

title: Over eight lakh youths given government jobs, says U.P. CM Adityanath
content: The CM says that now recruitment processes are transparent and merit-based, unlike in previous regimes where ‚Äúso much money was taken that they could not even look into the eyes of candidates‚Äù¬†

title: Government employees seek DA as Dasara gift
content: The DA, which should have been announced and offered once in six months, has turned out to be a distant dream, says APNGGOA President

title: Review plea in SC challenges norms on posting of consumer commission office-bearers
content: Petition filed by Parivarthan challenges the May 21 apex court judgment on the Consumer Protection Rules, 2020 on the appointment and other aspects of the president and members of the State and District Consumer Commissions

title: Kochi police leave for Mumbai to take director into custody
content: Sanalkumar Sasidharan detained in Mumbai airport after a lookout circular was issued against him for alleged harassment of woman actor on social media

title: Man held for ‚Äòmisleading‚Äô social media post on HNSS canal
content: Acting on a complaint from the HNSS officials, the Kuppam police crack down on the false claim, which went viral, creating confusion in the agrarian belt

title: KTR blames govt. for sanitation worker‚Äôs death at Mulugu, demands aid
content: Assures bereaved family of help from BRS cites non-payment of wages for 6 months as reason for driving worker to extreme step

title: Drunk driving kills a 20-year-old student, injures seven others after car rams police vehicle at Langer Houz
content: All five occupants of the car had been drinking before the crash; the injured include four passengers in the car and three policemen

title: Efforts under way to provide basic facilities on city outskirts in a phased manner, says G.T. Deve Gowda
content: Efforts will be made to gradually provide the basic infrastructure facilities to the residents of these localities as part of the overall development of Chamundeshwari Assembly constituency, says the MLA

title: No dearth of urea in Kurnool district, says Collector
content: Ranjith Basha warns of severe action against those who hoard urea or sell it above the designated price, and assures onion farmers that they will get ‚Çπ1,200 per quintal for their produce brought to the market yard

title: Custodial torture: Satheesan seeks dismissal of policemen from service
content: Four police officers, accused of assaulting a Youth Congress leader at Kunnamkulam, were suspended on Saturday. Satheesan says Congress will continue to fight till they are dismissed from service

title: Governor‚Äôs move puts Kerala‚Äôs private university reform in limbo
content: Arlekar refers Kerala State Private Universities (Establishment and Regulation) Bill, 2025, to the President

title: Battling anaemia, poverty, Andhra girl weaves dreams in weightlifting¬†
content: Born to a handloom-weaving family in Rajamahendravaram city, 14-year-old government municipal school student having clinched gold at the Commonwealth Weightlifting Championship-2025 is India‚Äôs next promising weightlifter

title: Ukraine war: Trump says US ready for phase-2 sanctions on Russia; follows Moscow‚Äôs biggest strike
content: Following Russia's largest aerial assault on Ukraine, which resulted in casualties and significant damage in Kyiv, US President Donald Trump has affirmed his readiness to impose a second phase of sanctions on Russia. President Zelenskyy strongly condemned the attacks, labeling them a deliberate act of war. European leaders, including Macron and Starmer, have also voiced their condemnation of the strikes.

title: Taliban back upgrade in ties as India explores ministerial visit
content: Amid ongoing efforts, the Taliban have expressed support for strengthened ties with India, suggesting high-level visits, including one from Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi. India is seeking a UNSC waiver for Muttaqi's travel ban to facilitate the visit, which aims to explore cooperation and trade.

title: Asia Cup: India crush South Korea 4-1 to lift fourth title, qualify for Hockey World Cup
content: India showcased a dominant performance, defeating defending champions South Korea 4-1 in Rajgir to secure their fourth Asia Cup hockey title. This victory not only marked a return to continental supremacy after eight years but also guaranteed their qualification for the 2026 Hockey World Cup. Dilpreet Singh's outstanding performance earned him the Player of the Match award.

title: J&K: Police detain 50 people over Hazratbal shrine emblem row
content: Following the defacement of a national emblem plaque inside Srinagar's Hazratbal shrine, authorities have detained nearly 50 people for questioning, sparking political controversy. Opposition parties criticize the plaque's installation as provocative, while the BJP defends it and accuses the National Conference of exploiting the situation. Security has been tightened around the shrine as investigations continue into the vandalism.

title: US recession: Moody‚Äôs warns average Americans, these states are at risk
content: Mark Zandi of Moody's warns that the US economy is nearing recession, with states comprising a third of the nation's GDP at high risk. Sluggish consumer spending, tariffs, and housing market struggles contribute to this vulnerability. Revised job reports reveal a hiring slowdown, adding to concerns about rising inflation and eroding consumer purchasing power.

title: 'Total collapse': Trump aide seeks more tariffs over Russia oil; asks EU to join
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has urged the European Union to join the US in increasing pressure on Russia, hinting at potential tariffs on nations buying Russian oil. The Trump administration has already imposed significant tariffs on India for its Russian oil trade.

title: Red Sea cables cut: Microsoft shares update; services affected in these regions
content: Microsoft resolved Azure cloud platform issues after Red Sea subsea cable cuts caused latency and service disruptions in the Middle East and Asia. The company rerouted traffic to minimize impact, and services are now operational. While repairs continue, Microsoft is monitoring and optimizing routing to reduce customer impact, as the cable cuts affected internet connectivity in multiple countries.

title: 'India has nothing to apologise': Tharoor slams Trump aide
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor defended India's mature approach amid US criticism over Russian oil imports, highlighting that other nations, including those in Europe and China, have larger economic ties with Russia. He cautioned against overlooking Trump's tariff threats and insults despite softened rhetoric, emphasising the real consequences faced by Indians.

title: Fever vs Mystics: Odds & spread; Top WNBA prop bets and prediction
content: On September 7, 2025, the Indiana Fever are heavily favored against the Washington Mystics at CFG Bank Arena. Betting odds strongly suggest a Fever victory, driven by their superior record, offensive efficiency, and key player performances, particularly from Kelsey Mitchell. While the Mystics' home advantage and rookie talent offer some intrigue, experts predict the Fever will likely cover the spread.

title: Nepal social media ban: Facebook, Twitter among 26 apps blocked; Govt explains why
content: Nepal has banned major social media platforms like Facebook, YouTube, and X after they failed to register with the government by the given deadline. This decision follows a Supreme Court directive to regulate online platforms and monitor content.

title: 'So this is your respect for farmers': JD(S) slams Kharge for his 'I planted 40 acres' rebuke
content: JDS criticized Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge for dismissing a farmer's grievances about crop damage in Kalaburagi. JDS accused Kharge of arrogance, stating that Congress only cares about farmers in speeches. In a clip from Kharge's Kalaburagi house, Kharge was seen claiming that his own crop loss was worse and accused the farmer of seeking publicity.

title: Inside Hyundai raid: How a monthlong op led US immigration to Georgia plant
content: A large-scale immigration raid at a Hyundai-LG battery plant in Georgia led to the detention of hundreds, including over 300 South Korean workers, sparking diplomatic concerns and scrutiny of visa practices. The operation, targeting unlawful employment, halted construction at the multibillion-dollar EV battery project.

title: Sports: Phillies dad explains giving Bader HR ball to Cheryl Richardson Wagner
content: In Miami, Drew Feltwell's son, Lincoln, received a home run ball. A Phillies fan demanded it back. Drew gave it up to avoid problems. Marlins staff gifted Lincoln a goodie bag. Phillies player Harrison Bader gave him a signed bat. The woman's identity was shared online. However, claims about her were untrue.

title: 'The Summer I Turned Pretty': Lauren Kyle shares her take on the movie
content: Lauren Kyle, wife of Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid, gave fans a glimpse into her evening with an Instagram Story about The Summer I Turned Pretty. The post comes just months after McDavid‚Äôs run to the 2025 Stanley Cup Finals and Kyle‚Äôs June launch of Bar Trove in Edmonton. The couple‚Äôs public support for each other continues to stand out.

title: Aryna Sabalenka‚Äôs new boyfriend: Who is Georgios Frangulis?
content: Aryna Sabalenka found solace and support in Brazilian entrepreneur Georgios Frangulis following the tragic loss of her ex-boyfriend. Their relationship became public in spring 2024, with Frangulis becoming a constant presence in her player's box. Beyond his support, Frangulis is the founder of Oakberry, an a√ßa√≠-based brand for which Sabalenka is an ambassador.

title: Heaviest defeat in ODI history! England break India's record as South Africa crumble
content: England inflicted a historic defeat on South Africa in Southampton, securing a record 342-run victory in the third ODI. Jofra Archer's fiery spell and Jacob Bethell's maiden century powered England to a massive 414/5, while South Africa crumbled to a mere 72 all out.

title: England pile 414 runs vs South Africa; Joe Root's heartfelt gesture steals the show - Watch
content: Joe Root's century and heartwarming gesture of gifting his batting gloves to a young fan stole the show during England's match against South Africa. Jacob Bethell's maiden international century and Jos Buttler's explosive innings further contributed to England's impressive 414-5 total.

title: Crisis in Japan? Shigeru Ishiba steps down as PM ‚Äì what led to it and what‚Äôs next
content: Shigeru Ishiba, the Japanese Prime Minister, resigned due to pressure from his party after election losses. He cited progress in US tariff negotiations as the reason for his departure. The Liberal Democratic Party will hold a leadership contest to choose a successor. Sanae Takaichi and Shinjiro Koizumi are potential candidates.

title: 'He realised India won't surrender': Ex-envoy on Trump‚Äôs tone shift; takes dig
content: Former diplomat KP Fabian criticised Donald Trump's tariffs on India. He called them baseless. Trump seems to realize India won't surrender to trade threats. India seeks friendship but resists dictation. Trump softened his tone, calling India-US ties 'very special'. Prime Minister Narendra Modi reciprocated warmly. He highlighted the strong partnership between the two nations.

title: VP polls: B Sudarshan Reddy urges MPs for support; calls it a vote for ‚Äòsoul of India‚Äô
content: INDIA bloc's Vice-Presidential candidate, B Sudarshan Reddy, has appealed to members of parliament to prioritize national interest over party affiliations in the upcoming election. He urged them to vote thoughtfully, emphasizing that the decision would impact the nation's soul. Reddy expressed his readiness to accept the outcome, framing it as a collective responsibility to strengthen the republic.

title: Manipur pact: Kuki groups warn against 'free passage' after NH-2 reopening
content: The reopening of National Highway-2, a vital supply route, has stirred unease in Manipur's peace process. Kuki-Zo armed groups, KNO and UPF, cautioned against interpreting it as acceptance of unrestricted movement between communities. This follows a renewed ceasefire agreement with the Centre, focusing on territorial integrity and a political solution.

title: Tua Tagovailoa vs Colts: Injury update sparks doubt; Dolphins QB status
content: Tua Tagovailoa will play in the Miami Dolphins‚Äô Week 1 matchup against the Indianapolis Colts despite past injury concerns. The quarterback confirmed his readiness, while Tyreek Hill is also expected to suit up. Get the latest injury update, game details, and what to expect from Miami‚Äôs offense in their season opener at Lucas Oil Stadium.

title: 'Four IPL teams for UP': CM Yogi Adityanath cheekily appeals to BCCI; gives strong reason
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has appealed to the BCCI to allocate more IPL teams to the state, emphasising its large population and improving sports infrastructure. Speaking at the UPT20 League closing ceremony, he argued that UP, with its 25 crore population, deserves at least four IPL teams.

title: Nearly half of Indian diaspora lives in just 10 countries! US tops list - details
content: India's diaspora, the world's largest at 3.43 crore, is significantly concentrated in ten countries, with the US and UAE leading. While the Gulf region remains a hub for NRIs, PIOs are largely based in Western nations. Remittances from the diaspora hit a record $135.46 billion, highlighting their economic impact.

title: Tyrese Haliburton‚Äôs note: Shares message with fianc√©e, recalls Iowa State roots
content: Tyrese Haliburton, recovering from a torn Achilles, revisited his Iowa State roots with fianc√©e Jade Jones, whom he met at the university. Celebrating Iowa State's victory over Iowa, Haliburton playfully suggested retiring Jones's cheerleading poms. The couple, who began dating in 2019, share a strong connection to their alma mater, where Haliburton honed his basketball skills.

title: Rain fury: Floods rip into Punjab's dwindling green cover, 5 lakh trees uprooted
content: Devastating floods in Punjab have significantly hampered efforts to expand the state's diminishing green cover, resulting in the loss of 4,94,956 trees across 776 hectares. With forest cover already low at 3.7% of its geographical area, the floods have deepened Punjab's ecological stress and caused an estimated damage of over Rs 360.5 lakh to the forest and wildlife preservation department.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Arshdeep Singh set to make history; huge T20I milestone awaits
content: Arshdeep Singh is on the cusp of becoming the first Indian bowler to claim 100 T20I wickets at the upcoming Asia Cup 2025 in Dubai. India's campaign starts on September 10 against the UAE, followed by a high-stakes match against Pakistan on September 14. The squad includes Surya Kumar Yadav as captain and Shubman Gill as vice-captain.

title: GST 2.0 savings: Price cuts across all major brands - Creta, Thar, Nexon & more
content: The implementation of GST 2.0 has led to significant price reductions across the Indian auto sector, with car manufacturers passing on the benefits to consumers. Savings range from Rs 65,000 to Rs 8.9 lakh, impacting models from Mahindra, Tata, Toyota, Skoda, Renault, BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and Hyundai.

title: Hyundai raid: US, South Korea seal deal for workers' release; what we know so far
content: South Korea and the United States finalized an agreement for the release of South Korean nationals detained during an immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in Georgia. Over 300 South Koreans were among the 475 individuals taken into custody during the operation, which targeted a plant under construction for electric vehicle battery production.

title: 'Abandon hateful politics': Mayawati warns of 'conspiracy' in UP; slams US tariffs
content: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati expressed concerns about a conspiracy to disrupt harmony in Uttar Pradesh. She urged governments to abandon hateful politics. Mayawati reviewed the party's organizational campaign in Lucknow. She criticized Donald Trump's tariff hike on Indian goods. Mayawati called it 'Trump tariff terror' emphasising the need for reforms to address poverty and unemployment.

title: 'Frustrating': Shreyas Iyer breaks silence on snub; reveals what players feel when left out
content: Shreyas Iyer addressed the mental challenges of squad omissions, emphasising self-belief and team success. Despite being left out of the Asia Cup 2025 squad, he stressed ethical work habits and supporting teammates. India, the defending champions, are gearing up for the Asia Cup, revealing their new jersey and intensifying practice sessions for their title defense.

title: 'Decided to resign': Japan PM Ishiba steps down; hopes to avoid LDP split
content: Under mounting pressure from the LDP following a significant defeat in the upper house elections, Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba announced his resignation. This decision, made after resisting calls for over a month, avoids a potential no-confidence vote. Ishiba's short tenure was marked by declining approval ratings and economic challenges, including rising rice prices, leading to his swift downfall.

title: PhysicsWallah IPO: Edtech giant files draft papers; eyes raising Rs 3,820 crore
content: PhysicsWallah, the edtech platform, has filed updated draft papers with Sebi to raise Rs 3,820 crore through an IPO. The IPO includes a fresh issue of shares and an offer for sale by promoters Alakh Pandey and Prateek Boob. The funds will be used for physical infrastructure, technology, marketing, and investments in subsidiaries, aiming to fuel expansion and growth initiatives.

title: NFL news: Mike Evans to play against Atlanta Falcons? Bucs WR cleared to play
content: Mike Evans is set to start for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in tonight's game against the Atlanta Falcons, confirmed by head coach Todd Bowles. Despite an earlier "rest" designation, Evans is ready to lead the Buccaneers' passing attack, especially with Chris Godwin sidelined. Expectations are high for Evans, who aims to continue his streak of 1,000-yard seasons.

title: 'Strength of BJP': PM Modi sits in last row during NDA workshop; MP shares photo
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi participated in a Bharatiya Janata Party workshop at the Parliament complex, emphasizing the importance of every party worker. The two-day event included sessions on the party's history and ways to improve efficiency for parliamentarians.

title: Watch: Indian woman caught shoplifting at Target; gasps, folds hands
content: A bodycam video surfaced showing an Indian woman, identified as Gujarati, being interrogated by police at a Target store for shoplifting. ‚ÄãIn the process of the interrogation, it was revealed that she was a serial shoplifter from that particular Target store, but that was the first time she was stopped. She admitted that she was going to resell some of the items she stole from the Target store.

title: 'Local Boy!': Suryakumar quips as crowd chants 'Samson, Samson' in Dubai ‚Äì Watch
content: Suryakumar Yadav's playful banter with Sanju Samson during Team India's Asia Cup 2025 practice in Dubai injected humor into the camp. Samson, vying for an opening spot, received strong fan support, while the team intensely trained for the tournament. The BCCI unveiled the official jersey, emphasising the team's determination to defend their title as Asian champions.

title: Fantasy rankings for Week 1
content:
ESPN's weekly PPR and IDP  fantasy football  rankings are an aggregate of our rankers (eight PPR, three IDP). They are Matt Bowen, Mike Clay, Tristan H. Cockcroft, Daniel Dopp, Eric Karabell, Liz Loza, Eric Moody and Field Yates. Karabell also provides his superflex rankings all season long. Rankings will be published every Tuesday and are updated throughout the week for news and emerging analysis. PPR rankings: 
 Quarterbacks  |  Running backs  |  Wide receivers  |  Tight ends  |  Kickers  |  D/ST IDP rankings: 
 Top 50 DLs, LBs, DBs from Clay, Cockcroft and Moody Eric Karabell's superflex rankings: 
 Top 150 QBs, RBs, WRs and TEs

title: Why Florida State should have your attention
content: the Seminoles beat the Crimson Tide 31-17 in a heavyweight matchup . it was a "program-shifting win," analysts call it a 'statement' for Mike Norvell's culture .

title: Rory wins 2nd Irish Open title in thrilling playoff
content: Rory McIlroy savored "a pretty cool year" after adding a second title to his Masters win . the world no. 2 had to eagle the 72nd hole just to take it to a playoff . he also won his home open for the second time at the same venue in 2016 .

title: Jayden Daniels throws first TD pass of the season
content: LANDOVER, MD. -- The  Washington Commanders  face the  New York Giants  in a NFL Week 1 matchup on Sunday. The Giants lost both matchups last season to the Commanders by a total of eight points. That gave Washington quarterback  Jayden Daniels  bragging rights over his former college teammate and best friend, Giants wide receiver  Malik Nabers . New Giants quarterback  Russell Wilson  will make his 200th NFL start in Week 1, becoming the 16th quarterback in NFL history to do so. Our two team reporters -- John Keim and Jordan Raanan -- are at Northwest Stadium, and they're keeping you updated on all the biggest plays and highlights.

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 2
content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day was candid in his postgame assessment of the drubbing of FCS Grambling . day said it was "not a matchup game" that was the theme of week 2, which featured multiple contenders playing FCS opponents or other unranked, lower-level teams .

title: Bucs' Baker Mayfield finds Emeka Egbuka for 30-yard touchdown pass
content: ATLANTA -- Division titles aren't won or lost in Week 1, but the NFC South featured a significant showdown Sunday when the  Tampa Bay Buccaneers  faced the  Atlanta Falcons . The Bucs are vying for their fifth straight division title while the Falcons hope second-year QB  Michael Penix Jr . can lead them to the playoffs for the first time since the 2017 season.

title: AP Week 2 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: four AP-ranked teams outscored their opponents by a combined 307-26 . four ranked teams scored 70 or more points, the second time in the AP poll era . it's the longest streak to begin a game in school history .
